intro: Scleranthus haslingeri, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers with five petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a hairy texture, and it has a shallow root system adapted to sandy or dry environments. Scleranthus haslingeri is often found in open, sunny habitats and is part of the Caryophyllaceae family.
